citation.article-title: Donghicola eburneus gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from seawater of the East Sea in Korea
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Donghicola [Dong.hi′co.la. N.L. n. Donghae the Korean name of the East Sea in Korea; L. suff. -cola (from L. n. incola) a dweller, inhabitant; N.L. masc. n. Donghicola a dweller of the East Sea in Korea].
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, non-spore-forming cocci or rods.
The major fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c and C16 : 0.
The type species is Donghicola eburneus.
